article_caption: A traditional pizza with tomato and basil

article_paragraphs.text: Pizza is one of the most popular foods in the world. But did you know it has a long history? People have eaten flat bread with toppings for thousands of years. However, the pizza we know today comes from Naples, Italy.

In the 18th century, poor people in Naples added tomatoes to their bread. It was cheap and tasty. Later, in 1889, a baker made a special pizza for Queen Margherita. He used red tomatoes, white cheese, and green basil. These are the colors of the Italian flag.

The Queen loved the pizza, and it was named after her. Today, you can find pizza everywhere. You can put almost any ingredient on it. Some people like pineapple, while others like spicy sausage. What is your favorite flavor?
